'Blockbuster LLC', formerly 'Blockbuster Inc.', is an American-based provider of
home movie and video game rental services, originally through video rental shops
(both owned and franchised), later adding DVD-by-mail, streaming, video on
demand and cinema theater. http://www.imdb.com/news/ni0228635/ At its
peak in 2004, Blockbuster had up to 60,000 employees. There are
around 500 Blockbuster stores left in the
U.S. http://movies.msn.com/movies/article.aspx?news=786476 with
locations in 17 countries worldwide, down from its peak of more than 9,000
stores in
2004. http://www.nytimes.com/2011/04/09/business/09blockbuster.html It
is headquartered in Englewood,
Colorado. "[http://www.blockbuster.com/corporate/privacyPolicy Privacy
Policy]." Blockbuster LLC Retrieved September 16, 2009. Because of poor
strategic planning, mismanagement and competition from other video rental
companies such as Netflix, Blockbuster has lost significant revenue. The company
filed for bankruptcy on September 23, 2010, and on April 6, 2011, was
bought by satellite television provider Dish Network at auction for $233 million
and the assumption of $87 million in liabilities and other
obligations. The acquisition was completed on April 26,
2011.

On January 16, 2013, Blockbuster placed its UK subsidiaries in administration,
putting over 4,000 jobs at risk. Stores outside the UK are not affected by the
administration and continue to trade as normal. On February 1, 2013, a large
number of Blockbuster stores in the UK were closed. The future of Blockbuster
operations in the UK is currently uncertain.
categories: Companies delisted from the New York Stock Exchange
Companies that have entered administration in the United Kingdom
Companies that have filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy
